project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Feature Summary

Can we make some of the classes and methods such as the _isSubscribed_ from our NotificationSubscriptionManager to be available in our public java API, as well as add the functionality to retrieve the unsubscribe link for a recipient?

This would make it possible for Plugin Vendors to integrate these functionalities into their plugins.

h5. Usage Scenario

If a user uses a plugin such as JETI instead of JIRA for handling the JIRA Service Desk email, even if the user removes the Disable Subscription from the email template, this would still appear in emails sent by the 3rd party add-on which could become confusing to customers especially if the customer opts out but still receive emails because the link is not working.

h5. Why

Adding the above to our JIRA public API would make it possible for custom plugins provided by our vendors mimic and better compliment the JIRA Service Desk product in usage experience.

(i) _We understand that the implementation of this functionality is still left to each individual vendor._
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Service Desk Expose Notification APIs to Plugin Developers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

We currently have an SLA Audit Log introduced since JSD 3.4.1 for troubleshooting SLA. Although this feature isn't designed for end users and should require no maintenance by Service Desk admins, there is no automatic house-cleaning provided for the data it accumulates in AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOGDATA and AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG tables.

On a heavily used JSD instance this tables could swell up to millions of records within a few months.

h2. Suggested Solution

Provide a scheduled job to clean up the AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOGDATA and AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG tables, or allow some configurable clean up schedule.
fields.summary: Provide clean up schedule job for AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOGDATA

fields.description:

Customer need to edit the value of the SLA field.

Example: 
Created an issue and SLA set the value of 8h. 
After that, there is a need to increase the value of the SLA field for a particular task, without changing the priority (SLA values are set to priority) or editing the current SLA configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Service Desk to change the SLA goal for a particular issue without defining a new goal in the SLA configuration.
fields.summary: As a SD agent, I would like to be able to modify the SLA goal for a particular issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Further to support ticket SDS-22261 and tickets JSDSERVER-4246 and JSDSERVER-3843...

Please could you reconsider the logic behind emails that are received into Service Desk projects so that any issues for another project, that are mentioned in the subject line, create a new Service Desk ticket rather than adding a comment to the non-Service Desk issue.

In my opinion, the mail channel that is set up for a Service Desk project should only be for that project. If someone wants to add a comment to a non-Service Desk project, then they should set up an incoming mail server/handler and send their email there.

As some people obviously would like the functionality to stay as it is (else you wouldn't have implemented JSDSERVER-4246), would it be possible to have an option, when setting up the email channel on a Service Desk project, to choose whether you want to disregard other projects mentioned in the subject or not?
fields.summary: Create a new Service Desk (SD) issue when an email is received in a SD project with a non-SD issue number in the subject (DON'T add a comment to the non-SD issue)

fields.description:
h5. Issue Sumamry

When a user accesses JIRA Service Desk customer portal and their timezone set  under their profile is different from the one used by the machine timezone, they do not get prompted that the timezone they are in is different.

When a user performs the same behavior from JIRA proper, they get a pop-up that the timezone is different and get asked if they want to update it. 

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Access JIRA Service Desk customer portal.
# Access the profile page and edit the timezone preference of the user.
# Save your change while maintaining the timezone for the machine is set to.
# Refresh the page.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA Service Desk would notify the user that the timezone in the preference is different from the timezone of the machine used to access JIRA.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA Service Desk does not show any notification.
fields.summary: Customer Portal triggers no Notification if the User's timezone is different from Machine Language

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition.
Currently, JIRA Service Desk Processing Log could let the Agents know which email is created or not including the Subject of the email. With an improvement to include the Email Body as well will be great to monitor which Email is the ticket created form. This will also help the agents to check those emails that are Rejected whether it is important or not.

h3. Suggestion Solution:
It will be great if there is a drop down for the Processing Log for each email status which will reveal the Email Body where the Agent could review it. For now, for the drop down to show just for the email that is Rejected will be useful.

h3. Why is it needed:
To help the agents review the emails especially for those that are rejected, so they could make a call whether it is urgent/important.
fields.summary: Processing Log to include Email Body

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If the Project Key is using one of the JQL reserved words, you are not able to click on Basic to edit a Queue filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Project using one of the [JQL Reserved Words|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver072/advanced-searching-829057400.html#Advancedsearching-Reservedwords]. I.E: {{int}}.
# Try to edit one of the Queues or create a new one or create a new report and add a  new series.
# The Basic search will be _grayed out_ and the following message is displayed: *This query is too complex to display in Simple Mode*.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should handle this just fine since it allows these words to be added as Project Key.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA does now allow you to use the Basic mode.

If you check the network requests, you will see that there's a 400 error with the following response:

{code}
{
	"errorMessages": ["jqlInvalid"],
	"errors": {
		"jql": "Error in the JQL Query: 'INT' is a reserved JQL word. You must surround it in quotation marks to use it in a query. (line 1, character 11)"
	}
}
{code}

h3. Workaround

# Rename the Project Key (if feasible).
# Keep using the advanced mode until this bug is fixed. ( This is not possible for SLA reports)
fields.summary: Unable to use basic search if Project Key contains reserved JQL words

fields.description:
h3. Problem 
Automated transitions triggered by integrated development tools do not trigger SLAs.

h3. Environment
JSD v3.6.1
Bitbucket Server v5.2.1

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Integrate JIRA with Bitbucket Server.
# Pick a Service Desk project and request type. Edit the associated workflow transition to mark issue with status _Done_ and set a fixed resolution with trigger {{Pull request merged}}.
 !trigger.png|thumbnail! 
 !postFunctions.png|thumbnail! 
# Configure the *Time to resolution* SLA to stop when issue entered status _Done_ and resolution is set.
 !stopSLA.png|thumbnail! 
# Test the trigger by merging pull request in the integrated Bitbucket Server.

h3. Expected result
Once the pull request is merged, the associated JIRA issue transitioned to status _Done_ and resolution is set. The *Time to resolution* SLA is stopped.

h3. Actual result
Once the pull request is merged, the associated JIRA issue transitioned to status _Done_ and resolution is set. However, the *Time to resolution* SLA doesn't stop.
 !result.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This Bug is also affecting JSD v3.5.2
fields.summary: SLA is not triggered if the transition is triggered by development tools

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Apparently, if you have created a customer account to met the condition to let "[Customer Access restricted page in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/give-access-to-unlicensed-users-from-jira-service-desk-829076204.html]", any linked JIRA Issue Macro on a Confluence Page would throw errors when the Customer is logging into Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Integrate JIRA Service Desk with Confluence.
# Create a Project and set the "Browse Project" permission to "Anyone"
# Create some issues in the project.
# Create a filter based on the Project issues and edit the permission to "Public"
# Create a Confluence Page and add JIRA Issue Macro for the filter, including JIRA Chart as well.
# Set the Space/Page to be open for public.
# Open a new browser session and access the page.
# The page will load the public issue.
# Create a Customer account in JIRA and Confluence, then log in to view the same page.

h3. Expected Result:
* Same like when accessing the page anonymously, the list of issue and chart will be shown.

h3. Actual Result:
* NPE happens.

h3. Environmet:
* JIRA 7.4.0
* JIRA Service Desk 3.6.0
* Confluence 6.2.2
fields.summary: Customers unable to view Public JIRA Issue in Confluence

Hello all,

 

I have seen that many other customers of yours are complaining related to how the customer portal works.

I have similar issues as well, and already commented/created other tickets on this matter but with no replies received.

I would really like to have a timeline for the following issues:

1.) search function: not working correctly, as the search function only searches in the subjects of the tickets

2.) add more columns and the ability to change them under the My Requests  page, like: created, updated, labels, priority. Also sorting would have to be available

3.)Ability to export issues

 

These are all must-haves as you already know. When are these changes going to be implemented. If they are not going to be implemented, at least show me some plugins that can make any of the above.

Depending of the answers received, the management team of my company will assess if paying for another year the maintenance fee is needed or not.

 

I hope I will get an answer fairly soon.

 

Best regards

h3. Summary

When creating reports in JIRA Service Desk, any select menu in advanced mode does not show the full list and instead forces the user to scroll up and down the page. This is different behavior than basic mode, where the options spill over the window for selection.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a JIRA Service Desk project and select Reports
 # Add a series
 # In the Filter by area, switch to advanced mode
 # Type in “Status =“

h3. Expected Results

The list of options should spill over the window so that all the choices are visible.
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-13 at 12.14.57.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

A list of possible statuses will appear - but the list will be hidden by the window

Scroll down with the mouse to see all the possible options.

!Screen Shot 2017-07-13 at 12.16.10.png|thumbnail!

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Situation*
 * use JIRA-Server for projects
 * use JIRA Service Desk for central processes, IT operations, requests, etc.
 * Users learn about JIRA and grow out of only using the portal
 * JIRA users have a frustrating user experience as service desk customers / complain
 * As we use Service Desk internally, I have to buy every license twice: JIRA + Agent

*Problem*
 * JIRA users (as customers) need to use the portal to create requests
 * JIRA users (as customers) need to use the portal to view their own requests, which breaks the UI / user experience. Need to see all tickets within one gui.
 * JIRA users (as customers) can not modify their own requests.
 * issue security can not use service desk fields (request participant), need automation plugin to sync values to custom fields (...)
 * granting JIRA users (as customers) view permission in Service Desks makes them see internal comments by the agents / ops team and breaks confidentiality. Comment restictions are not available in SD. (x) This is a show stopper for us.

*Workaround*
 * Abandon Service Desk and try to implement features in vanilla JIRA / Confluence + Forms. Reinvent the wheel.

*Suggestion*
 * Please improve the integration between SD and JIRA fields (issue security, etc.)
 * Please allow JIRA users to view and create their Service Desk Tickets using regular JIRA methods
 * Please allow JIRA users to modify their own Service Desk tickets
 * Please implement JIRA's comment restrictions, so that JIRA users do not see internal comments from the agents
 * Maybe find a suitable licensing scheme which involves (already licesed) JIRA users somehow

Thank you very much.

 

Best regards,

Martin
fields.summary: JIRA users as customers - please improve situation / integration / user experience

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If user has configured {{logout.url}} in the {{seraph-config.xml}}, the redirection upon logout from customer portal may fail to work if the website takes too long (>2s) to respond.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Modify the {{logout.url}} of {{seraph-config.xml}} file to set it to {{https://httpbin.org/delay/3}} (there will be 3s of delay when accessing this URL)
# Restart JIRA
# Login to customer portal via {{<base_url>/servicedesk/customer/user/login}}
# Try to logout

h3. Expected Results
The page get redirected to {{https://httpbin.org/delay/3}} after logout.

h3. Actual Results
The default logout page is shown and the request for the configured URL is cancelled in the Network log :
 !2017-07-10_redirect.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
When set {{logout.url}} to {{https://httpbin.org/delay/1}} (1s delay in response) the problem can no longer be reproduced.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: If the logout.url takes too long to respond Service Desk will cancel the redirect request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When user tries to perform a search in automation rule audit log a HTTP 500 error is thrown if JIRA is running on MS SQL DB.

h3. Environment
* MS SQL DB

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Navigate to *Project settings > Automation*.
# Choose a automation rule and click on "View log".
# Try to perform a search in the View log page.

h3. Expected Results
No error is thrown

h3. Actual Results

And following method is called when searching in the audit log :
{code}
// com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.internal.execution.history.dao.querydsl.ExecutionHistoryDaoImpl
    public List<String> getIssueKeysByRuleSetId(final long id, String issueKeySearchPattern) {
        return databaseAccessor.runInTransaction(connection ->
                connection
                        .select(EXECUTION_RULE_MESSAGE_ITEM.RULE_MESSAGE_VALUE)
                        .from(RULE_EXECUTION)
                        .leftJoin(RULE)
                        .on(RULE_EXECUTION.RULE_ID.eq(RULE.ID))
                        .leftJoin(RULE_SET_REVISION)
                        .on(RULE_SET_REVISION.ID.eq(RULE.RULESET_REVISION_ID))
                        .leftJoin(RULE_SET)
                        .on(RULE_SET_REVISION.RULE_SET_ID.eq(RULE_SET.ID))
                        .leftJoin(EXECUTION_RULE_MESSAGE_ITEM)
                        .on(EXECUTION_RULE_MESSAGE_ITEM.RULE_EXECUTION_ID.eq(RULE_EXECUTION.ID))
                        .where(RULE_SET.ID.eq(id).and(getIssueKeySearchPatternWhereClause(issueKeySearchPattern)))
                        .limit(ISSUE_KEY_QUERY_LIMIT)
                        .groupBy(EXECUTION_RULE_MESSAGE_ITEM.RULE_MESSAGE_VALUE)
                        .orderBy(EXECUTION_RULE_MESSAGE_ITEM.RULE_MESSAGE_VALUE.asc())
                        .fetch()
        );
    }
{code}

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment (except from migrating to another DB).

h3. Summary
The below documentation mentions that you only need to have the _Administer Projects_ permission of a particular project to be able to set the incoming email channel
https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver035/receiving-requests-by-email-894759477.html
* Quoting the below
** bq. Make sure you have the Administer Projects permission.
* Also quoting the below
** bq. If you are a JIRA Administrator, you can refer to Managing the email channel to learn more about global mail settings.
** This suggests that you can perform the tasks if you are *not* JIRA Administrator

However, you actually *need* the JIRA Administrator permission to be able to set this up. Here is a screenshot when logged in with _Administer Project_ permission, but not the _JIRA Administrator_ permission
!email.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion
Correct the documentation, clearly stating the required permissions needed to perform this tasks (and others)

h3. Summary
At the moment, a reporter can approve their own request if permission is given. 

h3. Example scenario
* There is a group of designated approvers to approve a particular request
* These approvers are also able to create requests which needs approval
* When this happens, they will be able to approve their own request

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Somehow, SLA would be automatically updated according to its configuration (start, pause, stop) whenever one of the ticket SLA cycles is STOP. But, if there is no SLA has its cycle STOP after transition or changes, the SLA would not be updated.

In this case, START and PAUSE condition should have the same behavior as STOP where it will be updated automatically when the condition is met. Not to mention that the other SLA will be updated as well when an SLA stop its cycle.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Navigate to _Project Administration > SLAs_
# Edit the "Time to resolution" SLA
# Add a "Waiting for customer" to "Pause on" condition.
# Make sure all Goals is set to "24/7 Calendar" so the SLA will keep counting.
# Save the SLA and create an issue.
# Then, transition the issue by clicking the "Respond to Customer" transition.
# Notice that the SLA for "Time to first response" is STOP and "Time to resolution" is PAUSED.
# Click the "Respond to Support" transition to change the status to "Waiting for Support"

h3. Expected Result:
* Like when doing the "Respond to Customer" transition, the SLA will start to count again.

h3. Actual Result:
* The SLA  stays in PAUSE.

h3. Notes:
* The ticket needs to be refreshed to get the actual condition of the SLA.
* Somehow, whenever there is another SLA that will STOP due to the transition/changes, all other SLA will be updated as well.
fields.summary: SLA update inconsistencies.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JIRA Service Desk, IE11 will only render a custom logo on a customer portal if the image is in a .PNG format. .BMP, .JPG, .GIF logos will break in IE11(see screenshots). Chrome, Firefox and Safari will render the any of the mentioned image formats without issue.
  
||IE11||Chrome||
|!Screen Shot 2017-03-10 at 4.47.25 PM.png|width=182,height=128!|!Screen Shot 2017-03-10 at 4.47.12 PM.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Environment
Tested with JIRA Service Desk 3.5.2 and 3.6.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

_On JIRA Service Desk:_
 # Navigate to: [NameOfYourProject] > Project Settings > Portal Settings: Logo
 # Click "Choose logo" and select a .BMP, .JPG or .GIF image
 # Save the selection
 # Access the customer portal in IE11

h3. Expected Results

Logo image is rendered in IE11
h3. Actual Results

Image is not rendered in IE11 (see screenshot in Summary)
h3. Notes
 * Renaming an image to .PNG will not work - the image needs to be converted to a .PNG
 * Firefox , Chrome, Safari will render all the mentioned image formats
 * This affects the Avatar as well.

h3. Workaround

Convert your logo to a .PNG image and upload to your customer portal.
fields.summary: Customer portal logo broken on IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Reproduced on an instance with over 400 ServiceDesk projects and customer portals.

On an instance with hundreds of Service Desks, try to access <jira-base-url>/servicedesk/customer/portals as a customer who has access to only 2 or 3 of those portals.

This page should load reasonably quickly especially when the user only has access to only a few portals

	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.lambda$hasPermission$5(ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager$$Lambda$887/1799350819.getAsBoolean(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.checkUserHasApplicationOrFalse(ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.hasPermission(ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.java:97)
...
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.user.permission.ServiceDeskPermissions.canViewProject(ServiceDeskPermissions.scala:58)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.user.permission.ServiceDeskPermissions.hasInternalCustomerAccess(ServiceDeskPermissions.scala:245)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.user.permission.ServiceDeskPermissions.canCreateRequest(ServiceDeskPermissions.scala:144)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.portal.InternalPortalServiceImpl.lambda$hasCustomerPortalPermission$13(InternalPortalServiceImpl.java:217)
...
com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.portal.InternalPortalServiceImpl.getCustomerVisiblePortals(InternalPortalServiceImpl.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.list.RequestListSearchQueryFactoryImpl.getAllVisiblePortals(RequestListSearchQueryFactoryImpl.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.list.RequestListProviderImpl.getAllVisiblePortals(RequestListProviderImpl.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.list.RequestListProviderImpl.getApprovalCount(RequestListProviderImpl.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.portal.providers.user.UserResponseProviderDataHelper.getApprovalsCount(UserResponseProviderDataHelper.java:91)
...
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.rest.CustomerResponseFactory.createResponse(CustomerResponseFactory.scala:62)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerPageRenderer.createPageParams(CustomerPageRenderer.scala:91)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The bottleneck is with permission checking for organization membership, which is done for each portal against the database by isMemberOfAnyOrganizationInProject():
{code}
select count("AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."ID") from "public"."AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER" inner join "public"."AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION" on "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION"."ID" = "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."ORGANIZATION_ID" inner join "public"."AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT" on "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT"."ORGANIZATION_ID" = "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION"."ID" where "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT"."PROJECT_ID" = ? and "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."USER_KEY" = ? limit ?
{code}
While the query itself may be executed very quickly, this begins to have a significant impact with instances with large number of portals because the query is being executed multiple times against the database directly, while executing the {{GET /portals}} request to ServiceDesk.

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to disable [Service Desk's Customer Organization feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver035/setting-up-service-desk-users-894759487.html#Settingupservicedeskusers-manageorgsManageorganizations] on the instance. Just a heads up on the main implication of disabling this feature, basically users will now need to manually list out members of their organization they would like to share their request with and cannot simply share with the entire organization once this feature is disabled.

Steps to disable the feature
# Log in to the following path on your test instance: <jira-base-url>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!Default.jspa
# Add the following parameter {{sd.customer.orgs.group.participants.disabled}} to the _Enable Dark Feature_ field and click Add

fields.description:
*Experienced Behavior*

During JIRA Service Desk automation startup PSMQ checks for outstanding jobs that need to reexecute. This task is performed by the localhost-startStop-1 thread and delays startup of the entire JIRA instance. 
* The delay may range from less than a second to multiple minutes depending on the number of entries that PSMQ checks. 

Log entries associated with this are included below. This example shows a delay of over nine minutes.

{noformat}
2017-06-25 09:41:35,892 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.s.p.a.internal.bootstrap.AutomationPluginLauncher] AutomationPlugin onStart() - Service Desk Automation Plugin is starting...
2017-06-25 09:41:35,914 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG      [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] getService bundle [com.atlassian.psmq]
2017-06-25 09:51:03,885 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.s.p.a.internal.bootstrap.AutomationPluginLauncher] AutomationPlugin onStart() - Service Desk Automation Plugin is started.
{noformat}

*Expected Behavior*

JIRA Service Desk Automation and PSMQ do not cause multiple minute delay when starting JIRA. 

*Steps to Reproduce* 

* Create instance with JIRA Service Desk 3.5.0 or newer. 
* Create requests
* Trigger an automation rule for each request
* Restart JIRA
* Monitor startup logging for "AutomationPlugin onStart()" and observe delay between "starting" and "started" entries

Length of delay will depend on number of issues. 
* ~600 issues shows 2sec delay
* ~1200 requests show 4sec delay
* Longest delay observed is over 10 minutes. Instance containing 100,000+ requests.
fields.summary: PSMQ causes delay during JIRA startup

fields.description:
This is related to the fix on cross commenting in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4246
 * Before 3.2.0, users can cross comment. When users sends an email to the email channel configured in project A with a subject containing the issue key of project B, JIRA will add this email as a comment to the issue in project B.
 * Between 3.2.0 - 3.2.5, users can no longer cross comment. SD creates a new issue in project B instead.
 * 3.2.6 onwards, users can cross comment again due to the fix in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4246
 * 4.18.1 onwards, users can no longer cross comment due to the fix in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6511

Some users have expressed that the behavior in 3.2.0 - 3.2.5 is preferred, the reasoning is that if they are sending an email to project A's mailbox, it means they want to have the issue created in project A.

However, some users have expressed that the behavior in 3.2.6 - 4.17.x is preferred, meaning that is an email is set to Project A's mailbox and contains a reference to an issue from Project B, they want the mail handler to add a comment to the issue from Project B, rather than creating a new issue in Project A.

There should be an option to allow users to switch between the two behaviors, to better suit their organization's use case.
fields.summary: Provide a configurable option for controlling the behavior of cross commenting in the Service Desk Mail Handler

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

Customers are currently able to have only one email address associated with their account, hence when they comment on an email from a different email address, JIRA would create a different account for the same customer.

h5. Usage Scenario

If a customer has multiple email accounts and receive a notification on an issue and reply from another account, JIRA would automatically create a new account for the customer using this email address as _it identifies each email address as a unique user_.

There is currently a feature request [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2373] that partly resolves the issue, however it still doesn't allow users to set multiple accounts and only allows anonymous users to add comments to the ticket.

h5. Feature Request

Can a feature be added to JIRA service desk that allows users to have multiple email addresses where by when an email comes in from the user, JIRA service desk is able to identify that the email is from the same user.
fields.summary: Allow customers the ability to have multiple Email Addresses

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Team,

 

I love your products and I'm playing with the JIRA Service Desk to compare it with some others similar products. I really like the project and the features you purpose.

 

But there's one behaviour that is not compliant with my expectations : the recipients/CC/BCC visibility and management when JIRA Desk sends notifications, like when the agent add a comment to a ticket.

 

In my current company, we are quite every time several people to work on the same support tickets : Agents (internal people), Customers ( several people from the same company), and Third Parties (several people from different companies). It's due to the role of my company in the workflow.

 

So, from an agent side, we have to manage who are the Recipients, the CC and sometimes the BCC. 2 consecutive comments could be sent with different Recipients/CC/BCC.  And the current way to manage it is to change the Request participants and the Watchers for every comments....  not very fun and source of mistakes.

 

 

The best would be to have the possibility to select (drag&drop) the Recipients/CC/BCC before sending the comment, and potentially for other notifications.

 

Is that something you could manage in the future?

 

Thanks & Regards,

 

Edouard
fields.summary: Improve Recipients/CC/BCC management when sending comments from tickets

h3. Problem Definition
The project's Customers list in earlier version like 3.1.4 includes Agent in the list for a public project but with a label {{AGENT}} next to the name and it helps to differentiate an Agent from a Customer. However, Agent (if he/she is part of the project's Service Desk Team) is not included in the project's Customers list in later versions like 3.3.0 and above.

h3. Suggestion
An option to include or exclude Agents in the project's Customers list on top of the label {{AGENT}} next to the name

h3. Why is it important
* In some cases, Agents raise tickets too and in the project's Customers list, we can easily tell how many open and close requests an Agent has.
* In some cases, Agents should not appear in the Customers list, the option to exclude Agents would help indefinitely.
fields.summary: Option to include or exclude Agents in a project's Customers list

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The language of the statuses in the customer notifications always follow the language of the user who triggered the status changes. This results in inconsistency of the status names in customer notifications when Agents are using different languages than the Customers'.

h3. Environment
JIRA's default language and Customer's profile language in Deutsch, Agent's profile language in English

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Customer raises a new ticket via portal - status of the ticket will be in Deutsch in the Portal.
# Agent transition the status of the ticket *manually* in JIRA by clicking on the transition buttons - status of the ticket will be in English in the Agent's view.
# Wait for the customer notification.

h3. Expected result
All content in the customer notification would be in Deutsch.

h3. Actual result
All content in the customer notification would be in Deutsch but the status that the Agent changed would be in English. For example, {{Michelle hat den Status auf Waiting for customer geändert.}}

h3. Notes
If the status is auto-transitioned by Automation rule and the Automation rule is triggered by a default user who uses Deutsch as the profile language, the status in customer notifications will be displayed in Deutsch.
fields.summary: The language of the Statuses in customer notifications are not consistent if the Agent is using different profile language than the customer's

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you define a SLA in a project A it is possible to add it in the queue of another project (B for instance).
But the SLA is not calculated in project B (column is empty).
You have to define the SLA using the same name as in project A and then the SLA is calculated.
So I think it is a bug.
fields.summary: Share SLA between projects

As a Service Desk administrator I would like to configure satisfaction surveys to only be sent out some of the time.  We expect a very high volume of requests to be opened and do not want a survey to be sent out for all of them. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the survey sending rate to be configurable.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk administrator I would like to configure satisfaction surveys to only be sent out some of the time.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Approvers can only view a request when the request requires approval or after the approval. However, if a user is added as the Approver before the approval stage (i.e. manually adding a user to the Approvers field), the approver will be restricted from viewing the request.

h3. Suggestion
Allow Approvers to view a request as soon as they get added so that they can opt in to get notification of the requests that will eventually require their approvals

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user creates a Service Desk project and selects the option to create a shared object where the new project shares items from the original project, it is observed that JIRA Service Desk does not copy over Service Desk related configurations found on the project settings page.

h5. Usage Scenario

If a Team wants to create a project that serves as a template for other projects and decide to use the above process to create a new project, it would be expected that it would mirror all requirements of the new project.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would create a Service Desk project that matches the exact configuration of the project selected when creating the project.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA Service Desk creates a new project that has all the standard JIRA project copied over but the Service Desk related configurations are not copied over with some even being broken such as the Request Type missing some of the ones that should have been added if the user created the new project without selecting a template.
fields.summary: Create Shared Object Broken For Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Apparently, participants of a request have a control to whom the request is "Shared" with even though it is not the Reporter. Hence, they can actually remove themselves from the Request and unable to view it after that. Also, they can remove other parties from the request as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk Project.
# Create an Organization and add Customer 1 and Customer 2 inside.
# Let Customer 1 create a request from the portal and share it to the Organization.
# Logout from Customer 1 and log in back as Customer 2.
# Access the previous request.
# There is always an option to remove the Participant which is the Organization.

h3. Suggested Solution:
* Provide the ability to disallow (and allow) Request participants to remove other participants

h3. Notes:
* This also applies to single users as well, not just Organization.
fields.summary: Provide ability to disallow Request Participants to remove other participants

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello 
I'd like to suggest some features to extend the possibilities available on request sharing in customer portal.
Why I'm asking for this is that in many companies rather complicated structure and supervisors often want to see and control requests created by their staff.
Currently requester could be forced to share his requests by default but with all the organization. Automatic sharing on request creation with single user is not available. And sharing with all organization is not really secure.
Sharing with hands is annoying and people can forget to share request.
Another problem is that requesters forced to share their requests by default if they are included in one organization only. Yes they can choose the private mode, but forget to do it.
So what I'm suggesting is to make more options available on request sharing:
 * option for requester profile to share requests to a single person (supervisor) controlled by administrator
 * option to add shares on request creation ( I think some kind of multi-user picker field available in the request template for customer portal will do the job)
 * option for customer portal so administrator could choose if requesters can share their requests by default or have to do it manually.
 * option to block sharing of the request for specific users.
 * and the most important option - view requests in organization access should be controllable so administrator could choose users that can view requests in organization.


 Please get back to me for any clarification.
Thank you very much for a great product and let's make it even better!
Best regards, Nikolay
fields.summary: Sharing of the request

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Emails with attachments that have long UTF-8 filenames fail when processed by the Service Desk inbound mail handler due to the content-type being parsed incorrectly.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.6
* JIRA Service Desk 3.5.0
* Gmail for both sender and inboud mail account

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a mail handler for a service desk project in *Project settings -> Email Requests*
# Send an email to the mail handler to create a new request attaching a file with a long UTF-8 encoded filename
** This consistently generates a failure for example:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Еу пробо афферт лабитур вел, игнота менандри дефинитионем ех меи, сит ат ириуре ассентиор.png 
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Ticket is created by the mail handler, file is attached without issue.

h3. Actual Results
The ticket gets created, but the file is not attached and a failed SQL insert is recorded in the atlassian-jira.log
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2017-06-12 18:47:04,367 Caesium-1-1 ERROR admin     [c.a.p.i.util.runner.AuthenticationContextUtilImpl] Unexpected error while running action as user 'admin'
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:FileAttachment][filename,Еу пробо афферт лабитур вел, игнота менандри дефини
тионем ех меи, сит ат ириуре ассентиор.png][issue,13403][author,admin][created,2017-06-12 18:47:04.301][thumbnailable,1][mimetype,image/png; 
        name="=?UTF-8?B?0JXRgyDQv9GA0L7QsdC+INCw0YTRhNC10YDRgiDQu9Cw0LHQuNGC0YPRgCDQstC10LssINC40LPQvQ==?=
        =?UTF-8?B?0L7RgtCwINC80LXQvdCw0L3QtNGA0Lgg0LTQtdGE0LjQvdC40YLQuNC+0L3QtdC8INC10YUg0LzQtdC4?=
        =?UTF-8?B?LCDRgdC40YIg0LDRgiDQuNGA0LjRg9GA0LUg0LDRgdGB0LXQvdGC0LjQvtGALnBuZw==?="][filesize,635096][id,11101] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.fileattachment (ID, is
sueid, MIMETYPE, FILENAME, CREATED, FILESIZE, AUTHOR, zip, thumbnailable) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)))
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:299)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.createValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:172)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.insertAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:265)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.access$100(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:102)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager$5.apply(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:521)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager$5.apply(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:518)
        at com.atlassian.fugue.Either$RightProjection.map(Either.java:825)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachmentFromFile(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:518)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachmentImpl(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:483)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.tryCreateAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:610)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:605)
        ... 3 filtered
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

In testing, I found that it appears the mail handler is not parsing the content-type properly and is including the file name in the mimetype field of the *fileattachment* table. Most of the time this simply adds the filename to the mimetype field in the *{{fileattachment}}* table and that does not seem to cause any other issues.  However, with long UTF-8 encoded filenames the value exceeds the column's size in the database triggering the SQL exception.

This is the content-type section from the raw mail that is attached:  [^raw-mail.txt] 
{noformat}
Content-Type: image/png; 
        name="=?UTF-8?B?0JXRgyDQv9GA0L7QsdC+INCw0YTRhNC10YDRgiDQu9Cw0LHQuNGC0YPRgCDQstC10LssINC40LPQvQ==?=
        =?UTF-8?B?0L7RgtCwINC80LXQvdCw0L3QtNGA0Lgg0LTQtdGE0LjQvdC40YLQuNC+0L3QtdC8INC10YUg0LzQtdC4?=
        =?UTF-8?B?LCDRgdC40YIg0LDRgiDQuNGA0LjRg9GA0LUg0LDRgdGB0LXQvdGC0LjQvtGALnBuZw==?="
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
No workaround has been found at this time.

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user creates an issue via email, because JIRA service desk only allows the project to have one incoming mail channel, if the issue is then moved to a different issue type, would stop sending notifications and finding the impacted issues would be quite difficult. 

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue in a Service Desk project via customer portal.
# Move the issue to a different issue type because as the agent you see it is not raised under the correct request type.

h5. Observation

JIRA Service Desk would clear out the customer request type field found on the right hand panel under service desk following the move. The problem however is that it does not also reset the customer request type field entirely, it just clears the Request Type field we see on the panel to _No Match_ as seen below:
 !Selection_069.png|thumbnail! 

This can be confirmed by adding the Customer Request Type to the view issue screen.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA Service Desk would clear the request type also removing all values from the field and allow admins to be able to find issues which have no request type using the query
{code}
"Customer Request Type" is EMPTY
{code}

h5. Actual Behavior

As shown in the image earlier, the data that was originally in the field is still in the actual Customer Request Type field and using the JQL in the above query would result in an empty query though the Request Type field shows no match.

h5. Workaround

User would need to query the JIRA instance for all issues of a particular issue type that do not have the expected Request type associated with them using a query like the below:
{code}
"Customer Request Type" != "<add the request type expected for the issue type here>" and project = "Your Project" and issuetype = "your issue type"

/* It there are more than 2 or more issues, modify the query to*/
"Customer Request Type" not in "<add the request type expected for the issue type here>" and project = "Your Project" and issuetype = "your issue type"
{code}
fields.summary: Move Issue Breaks Notification In Service Desk

 # Raise a request from customer1
 # Add customer2 as a request participant
 # Change the Reporter to customer2

h3. Expected Results

A warning similar to that given when trying to set the Request Participant to include the Reporter, and the action to be blocked.

!screenshot-2.png!

Image copied from JSDSERVER-5112
h3. Actual Results

The reporter and request participant are set to the same user, giving rise to other known issues (e.g. Having the same user as reporter and request participants leaves the issue not transitionable through customer portal)
h3. Workaround

Manually update the field(s) to avoid having the same user as both Reporter and Participant.

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

In JIRA service desk, it is possible for a user to belong to multiple organizations.

Can a functionality be added so that when a customer creates an issue from the customer portal, they are required to select an organization the issue is to be shared with rather than doing this after the issue has been created?

If a customer is a member of multiple organizations. If he decides to raise an issue and the issue is meant to alert only members of a specific group, there is no way to ensure the customer selects an organization when they create the issue or even after the issue has been created.

h5. Suggestion

Add a functionality that allows the project admin to force the selection of the organization field when it is required for the project in question.

Some administrators have intentionally modified permissions to prevent certain agents from doing things such as deleting issues. Project Administrators can override these changes when presented with that error, and can modify Service Desk against the will of their administrators.

An option to disable this ability would be appreciated.

h3. Workaround

* Transition the issue via Service Desk agent issue view.
* Modify any third-party scripts to prevent them from adding a customer to Request Participants if that customer is also the Reporter on an issue. 

h3. Notes

Related to JSDCLOUD-5241
fields.summary: Having the same user as reporter and request participants leaves the issue not transitionable through customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
This issue will not be always replicable but, there is a chance for JIRA to do multiple login requests when a user only did one attempt of login that is failing. This will make the user to be required to put captcha in a single failed login attempt.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a new customer.
# Exclude the customer on every Customer Portal
# Get the portal link for a ticket
# Access the link and try to log in using the new customer
# An error will be showing up that the user is not allowed to log in, not telling that the request is not accessible.

h3. Expected Result:
* The customer will be logged in and then a notice that the request is not accessible will be shown.

h3. Actual Result:
* It will said that the login failed due to wrong username/password and the logs will show that multiple login attempts that force the user to do captcha check later. Taken from {{atlassian-jira-security.log}} notice the multiple login requests in one second:
{noformat}

2017-05-17 17:39:44,477 http-nio-8719-exec-1 anonymous 1059x542x1 1tdroff 10.60.2.86 / The user 'custom1' is NOT AUTHORIZED to perform this request
